bibl.title: Interlude: A Series Containing a Hemerology with Lengths of Daylight.
bibl.note: Through the correlation of the months and the lengths of daylight, the ostraca can be assigned a date between A.D. 112 and 232, with preference for the latter half of this span. In light of other dates from Medinet Madi, sometime between A.D. 170 and 200 is most likely. - See in part. pp. 68-69: Papyri Graecae Magicae (2nd c. B.C. - 6th c. A.D.); - 69-70: Hemerology for the Homeromanteion (3rd-4th c. A.D.); - 70: Sortes Astrampsychi (3rd-6th c. (?) A.D.); - 71: P. Kellis Gr. I, 82 and 83 (4th c. A.D.).
bibl.seg: NAETHER Franziska and Micah ROSS, Interlude: A Series Containing a Hemerology with Lengths of Daylight.

Through the correlation of the months and the lengths of daylight, the ostraca can be assigned a date between A.D. 112 and 232, with preference for the latter half of this span. In light of other dates from Medinet Madi, sometime between A.D. 170 and 200 is most likely. - See in part. pp. 68-69: Papyri Graecae Magicae (2nd c. B.C. - 6th c. A.D.); - 69-70: Hemerology for the Homeromanteion (3rd-4th c. A.D.); - 70: Sortes Astrampsychi (3rd-6th c. (?) A.D.); - 71: P. Kellis Gr. I, 82 and 83 (4th c. A.D.).
